channel.title: MS or Open?
channel.description:
Well, I often use an older version of MS Office for school assignments, but now that there are so many new functions in the recent versions I've decided to get either MS Office 07 or Open Office 08.
Open Office 08 does have a free download link but I'm not focusing on price at the moment. I'm not too sure if MS Office 07 has a free download link.
I'm requesting you to post your opinion.
I expect this to be the right section to start this topic as it is partially associated with homework. :|

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

item.title: MS or Open?
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

The newer office is really buggy.

If you use MS, go for an older version.

For open…I use it on my linux box. It’s pretty good. A little slower though.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2008, 08:07:58 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Unhandled, post:2, topic:228220”]Obviously Office 07 isn’t free, but that isn’t a problem if you know where to download it from.
It’s not so much the word processor itself, but the format it saves in.
DOCX (Microsoft Word) is a proprietary format, which means you will be stuck using it with Microsoft Office. ODF (OpneOffice) on the other hand, is 100% open source and an ISO standard.
There is no denying it, Word is a much better word processor than OpenOffice in terms of functionality.
I personally use the Sun ODF Plugin for Microsoft Office, which allows me to use the great functionality, without having to save my documents in a proprietary format.
You can get the ODF plugin here: http://www.sun.com/software/star/odf_plugin/index.jsp

So in conclusion, I use the best parts of both.[/quote]I was sure that OpenOffice handled the MS format…

Read full topic

Care to explain why not?

I’d have to go with Open Office here. It has the option to save to Microsoft Office 2003’s various formats (I think), so there shouldn’t be any issues with transferring them to a school computer to print. But hey, don’t listen to me. I’m just someone who is barely active here.

item.title: MS or Open?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Obviously Office 07 isn’t free, but that isn’t a problem if you know where to download it from.
It’s not so much the word processor itself, but the format it saves in.
DOCX (Microsoft Word) is a proprietary format, which means you will be stuck using it with Microsoft Office. ODF (OpneOffice) on the other hand, is 100% open source and an ISO standard.
There is no denying it, Word is a much better word processor than OpenOffice in terms of functionality.
I personally use the Sun ODF Plugin for Microsoft Office, which allows me to use the great functionality, without having to save my documents in a proprietary format.
You can get the ODF plugin here: http://www.sun.com/software/star/odf_plugin/index.jsp

So in conclusion, I use the best parts of both.

Read full topic

Open Office 08 does have a free download link but I’m not focusing on price at the moment. I’m not too sure if MS Office 07 has a free download link.
